summary: Email correspondence between Assistant U.S. Attorney Maurene and defense attorney Brendan Quigley regarding scheduling an interview with David Rodgers, a witness in the Epstein investigation. The email reveals prosecutors plan to question Rodgers about a specific entry in Epstein's flight logs from August 1, 1997, which may be connected to a missing Florida teenager.

persons.name: Maurene
persons.context: Prosecutor from the Southern District of New York coordinating the interview with witness David Rodgers and discussing the flight log entry related to the missing teenager.

persons.name: Brendan Quigley
persons.context: Partner at Baker Botts representing David Rodgers, communicating with prosecutors about scheduling the interview and providing flight logs.

persons.name: David Rodgers
persons.context: Individual based in Florida who is being interviewed by prosecutors regarding flight records related to the Epstein investigation. Produced flight logs from 1991-2013.

persons.name: Andrew Lankler
persons.context: Attorney at Baker Botts copied on the email correspondence regarding the David Rodgers subpoena.

persons.name: Wendy
persons.context: Mentioned as a colleague who may need to contact David Rodgers directly to arrange travel logistics.

connections.description: Quigley is representing Rodgers in connection with a subpoena and interview request from prosecutors.
Prosecutor and defense attorney communicating about scheduling a witness interview and sharing information.
Both are attorneys at Baker Botts working on the David Rodgers case.
Rodgers is a witness being interviewed by prosecutor Maurene regarding Epstein flight logs.

events.title: Scheduled Interview with David Rodgers
events.description: Planned meeting between prosecutors and David Rodgers at 1 St. Andrew's Plaza in New York to discuss flight records related to the Epstein investigation.

events.title: Flight Log Entry Investigation
events.description: Prosecutors note a flight log entry from August 1, 1997, showing an individual with a name similar to a missing Florida teenager, prompting questions for David Rodgers.

events.title: Initial Flight Log Production
events.description: Brendan Quigley provides initial flight logs for David Rodgers covering January 23, 2006 to September 19, 2013, to prosecutors.

events.title: Additional Flight Log Production
events.description: Brendan Quigley provides additional flight logs for David Rodgers covering 1991 to January 2006 to prosecutors.

locations: 1 St. Andrew's Plaza, New York, NY 10007
keyFacts: Prosecutors planned to question David Rodgers about a specific flight log entry from August 1, 1997, that may be connected to a missing Florida teenager.
The flight log entry shows an individual with a name similar to the missing teenager on a flight designated as from SAR to ZOR.
David Rodgers produced extensive flight logs covering the period from 1991 to 2013 as part of the Epstein investigation.
Prosecutors viewed David Rodgers as a witness and had been seeking to interview him since at least July 2019.
The correspondence reveals ongoing investigation into Epstein's flight logs and potential connections to missing persons cases.
